content: What last name of a famous American inventor is also a unit used to measure electrical power?

The last name you're referring to is "Watt." James Watt was a Scottish inventor and engineer who improved the Newcomen steam engine in the 18th century, making it more efficient. His improvements were so significant that the unit of power, the watt, was named in his honor. One watt is defined as one joule per second and is used to measure the rate of energy conversion or transfer.
